text: John Baker (1731–1787) was a militia leader during the American Revolutionary War. Most notably he led the American militia in the Battle of Thomas Creek on May 17, 1777 against the British army of 250. Baker County, Georgia was named after him. == References == Category:1731 births Category:1787 deaths Category:Georgia (U.S. state) militiamen in the American Revolution
title: John Baker (American Revolutionary War)
